elements.content: In the present work, we report a new manganese single-chain magnet built from tetranuclear MnII 2MnIII 2 mixed-valence units linked by end-on azido and oximato bridges. All of the intra- and intercluster interactions involve end-on azido bridges, resulting in one ferromagnetic chain of ferromagnetic clusters with local ground state S = 9.
elements.clean_text: In the present work, we report a new manganese single-chain magnet built from tetranuclear MnII 2MnIII 2 mixed-valence units linked by end-on azido and oximato bridges. All of the intra- and intercluster interactions involve end-on azido bridges, resulting in one ferromagnetic chain of ferromagnetic clusters with local ground state S = 9.

elements.content: A new chain of clusters exhibiting single-chain-magnet response has been built with MnII 2MnIII 2 mixed-valence rings linked by end-on azido bridges. Ferromagnetic intra- and intercluster interactions allow formation of a chain of local ground state S = 9.
elements.clean_text: A new chain of clusters exhibiting single-chain-magnet response has been built with MnII 2MnIII 2 mixed-valence rings linked by end-on azido bridges. Ferromagnetic intra- and intercluster interactions allow formation of a chain of local ground state S = 9.

elements.content: Research of molecule-based compounds that have a remnant magnetization in the absence of the external magnetic field is a growing topic in coordination chemistry since the discovery of the first single-molecule magnet (SMM) in 1993. More recently, Gatteschi et al. extended the study to one-dimensional (1D) systems (single-chain magnets, SCMs), which usually show greater relaxation times. Common features needed to obtain this kind of molecular or 1D system are a nonzero magnetic response at low temperature, anisotropic character, and well-isolation in the crystalline packing.
elements.clean_text: Research of molecule-based compounds that have a remnant magnetization in the absence of the external magnetic field is a growing topic in coordination chemistry since the discovery of the first single-molecule magnet (SMM) in 1993. More recently, Gatteschi et al. extended the study to one-dimensional (1D) systems (single-chain magnets, SCMs), which usually show greater relaxation times. Common features needed to obtain this kind of molecular or 1D system are a nonzero magnetic response at low temperature, anisotropic character, and well-isolation in the crystalline packing.

elements.content: One of the major synthetic challenges in the design of molecular SMM or 1D SCM compounds is to reach an overall ferri- or ferromagnetic response. From the initial use of the azido ligand in 2001 in medium-nuclearity M9 cluster chemistry and the experimental proof that this ligand tends to end-on coordination modes (inducing ferromagnetic interactions) in cluster compounds, azido has been extensively employed in cluster syntheses. During the past decade, the azido ligand contributed to reach giant spin S = 83/2 Mn19 systems or several impressive high-nuclearity clusters containing more than 20 metallic centers in carboxylato, alkoxo, pyridylalkoxo, or salicyloximato chemistry, often exhibiting SMM properties. In contrast, manganese/pyridyloximato/azido chemistry remains practically unexplored in spite of its potential possibilities and only some Mn4 and Mn6 units and one chain of Mn4 units have been reported until now.
elements.clean_text: One of the major synthetic challenges in the design of molecular SMM or 1D SCM compounds is to reach an overall ferri- or ferromagnetic response. From the initial use of the azido ligand in 2001 in medium-nuclearity M9 cluster chemistry and the experimental proof that this ligand tends to end-on coordination modes (inducing ferromagnetic interactions) in cluster compounds, azido has been extensively employed in cluster syntheses. During the past decade, the azido ligand contributed to reach giant spin S = 83/2 Mn19 systems or several impressive high-nuclearity clusters containing more than 20 metallic centers in carboxylato, alkoxo, pyridylalkoxo, or salicyloximato chemistry, often exhibiting SMM properties. In contrast, manganese/pyridyloximato/azido chemistry remains practically unexplored in spite of its potential possibilities and only some Mn4 and Mn6 units and one chain of Mn4 units have been reported until now.

elements.content: The azido ligand also plays a significant role in the synthesis of SCM, as a bridge in conventional homospin chains like [Co(bt)(N3)2] n (bt = 2,2′-bithiazoline) or as a linker in chains of clusters like [Mn4(hmp)6(N3)2] n (ClO4)2n [hmpH = 2-(hydroxymethyl)pyridine], [Mn3O(tbusalox)3 (N3)(CH3OH)4] (tbusalox = 3,5-di-tert-butylsalicylaldoxime), [Mn6(N3)4(O2CMe)2(dpkd)2 (dpkme)2(MeOH)2]n (dpkd2− and dpkme2- = diol derivatives of dipyridylketone), or [Mn6O2(4-MeOsalox)6(N3)2(MeOH)4] (MeOsalox = 2-hydroxy-4-methoxysalicylaldoxime).
elements.clean_text: The azido ligand also plays a significant role in the synthesis of SCM, as a bridge in conventional homospin chains like [Co(bt)(N3)2] n  (bt = 2,2'-bithiazoline) or as a linker in chains of clusters like [Mn4(hmp)6(N3)2] n (ClO4)2n  [hmpH = 2-(hydroxymethyl)pyridine], [Mn3O(tbusalox)3 (N3)(CH3OH)4] (tbusalox = 3,5-di-tert-butylsalicylaldoxime), [Mn6(N3)4(O2CMe)2(dpkd)2 (dpkme)2(MeOH)2]n (dpkd2- and dpkme2- = diol derivatives of dipyridylketone), or [Mn6O2(4-MeOsalox)6(N3)2(MeOH)4] (MeOsalox = 2-hydroxy-4-methoxysalicylaldoxime).

elements.content: Following our previous work in metal oximato chemistry, we have centered our attention on the ligand 6-methylpyridine-2-carbaldehydeoxime, (6-Mepy)C(H)NOH, for which only one NiII 9 compound has been characterized. In this work, we report the initial use of (6-Mepy)C(H)NOH in manganese chemistry describing the neutral 1D system [Mn4{(6-Mepy)C(H)NO}4(N3)6] n ·2nEt2O (1·2Et2O).
elements.clean_text: Following our previous work in metal oximato chemistry, we have centered our attention on the ligand 6-methylpyridine-2-carbaldehydeoxime, (6-Mepy)C(H)NOH, for which only one NiII 9 compound has been characterized. In this work, we report the initial use of (6-Mepy)C(H)NOH in manganese chemistry describing the neutral 1D system [Mn4{(6-Mepy)C(H)NO}4(N3)6] n ⋅2nEt2O (1⋅2Et2O).

elements.content: Ligand (6-Mepy)C(H)NOH was synthesized by a conventional reaction of 6-methylpyridine-2-carboxaldehyde and hydroxylamime hydrochloride in a basic (NaCH3COO) medium. Compound 1·2Et2O was obtained in good yield by a reaction in a methanolic medium of Mn(hfacac)2·3H2O, (Mepy)C(H)NOH, and NaN3 in a 1:1:2 ratio. After the resulting dark-brown solution was layered with diethyl ether, X-ray-quality prismatic crystals of 1·2Et2O were obtained after 4 days. Synthesis can also be carried out starting from weakly coordinating anions as manganese perchlorate or triflate salts. The structure of 1 can be envisaged as neutral chains of tetranuclear MnII 2MnIII 2 rings (Figure ) linked by means of double end-on azido bridges. The MnN4O2 trans-coordination environment around the trivalent Mn(1) atom is defined by four azido N atoms and two O atoms from bridging oximato groups. The Mn−N bond distances are similar [2.105(3) and 2.169(3) Å] and larger than the Mn−O(1a,b) bond distances of 1.908(3) Å. Additionally, the polyhedron around Mn(1) is a compressed octahedron along the O−Mn−O axis. The MnN6 cis-coordination environment for the divalent Mn(2) atom is defined by the pyridinic N donors of two 6-MepyNO− ligands, two N atoms from bridging oximato groups, and two azido N atoms that bridge Mn(2) with Mn(1) and Mn(1b). Bond distances range between 2.194(3) and 2.273(3) Å. The octahedron is strongly distorted, exhibiting trans and cis bond angles in the 149.6(1)−167.8(1)° and 73.3(1)−115.4(1)° ranges, respectively. Each neighbor Mn(1)/Mn(2) atom is bridged by one η1:η1:η1:μ-(6-Mepy)C(H)NO¯ oximato and one end-on azido ligand (Figure ). The Mn(1)−N(1)−Mn(2) bond angle is 117.1(1)°, resulting in an intraring Mn···Mn distance of 3.6669(8) Å. The Mn(1b)−O(1)−N(8)−Mn(2) torsion angle takes a value of 15.2(3)°.
elements.clean_text: Ligand (6-Mepy)C(H)NOH was synthesized by a conventional reaction of 6-methylpyridine-2-carboxaldehyde and hydroxylamime hydrochloride in a basic (NaCH3COO) medium. Compound 1⋅2Et2O was obtained in good yield by a reaction in a methanolic medium of Mn(hfacac)2⋅3H2O, (Mepy)C(H)NOH, and NaN3 in a 1:1:2 ratio. After the resulting dark-brown solution was layered with diethyl ether, X-ray-quality prismatic crystals of 1⋅2Et2O were obtained after 4 days. Synthesis can also be carried out starting from weakly coordinating anions as manganese perchlorate or triflate salts. The structure of 1 can be envisaged as neutral chains of tetranuclear MnII 2MnIII 2 rings (Figure ) linked by means of double end-on azido bridges. The MnN4O2 trans-coordination environment around the trivalent Mn(1) atom is defined by four azido N atoms and two O atoms from bridging oximato groups. The Mn-N bond distances are similar [2.105(3) and 2.169(3) Å] and larger than the Mn-O(1a,b) bond distances of 1.908(3) Å. Additionally, the polyhedron around Mn(1) is a compressed octahedron along the O-Mn-O axis. The MnN6 cis-coordination environment for the divalent Mn(2) atom is defined by the pyridinic N donors of two 6-MepyNO- ligands, two N atoms from bridging oximato groups, and two azido N atoms that bridge Mn(2) with Mn(1) and Mn(1b). Bond distances range between 2.194(3) and 2.273(3) Å. The octahedron is strongly distorted, exhibiting trans and cis bond angles in the 149.6(1)-167.8(1)° and 73.3(1)-115.4(1)° ranges, respectively. Each neighbor Mn(1)/Mn(2) atom is bridged by one η1:η1:η1:μ-(6-Mepy)C(H)NO¯ oximato and one end-on azido ligand (Figure ). The Mn(1)-N(1)-Mn(2) bond angle is 117.1(1)°, resulting in an intraring Mn⋅⋅⋅Mn distance of 3.6669(8) Å. The Mn(1b)-O(1)-N(8)-Mn(2) torsion angle takes a value of 15.2(3)°.

elements.content: Partially labeled plot of the local Mn4 units of 1. Manganese color code: MnII, orange; MnIII, dark green.
elements.clean_text: 1  Partially labeled plot of the local Mn4 units of 1. Manganese color code: MnII, orange; MnIII, dark green.

elements.content: It is noteworthy that the double azido−oximato bridge is not a recognizable fragment in previously reported manganese/azido/oximato clusters. The bridging ligands are placed above and below the plane defined by the four Mn atoms in a pseudotetrahedral arrangement as a result of the local symmetry. An important feature is that the two O−Mn(1)−O axis are quasi-orthogonal between them. Each tetranuclear unit is linked to two equivalent ones by means of double end-on azido bridges [Figure (top)], with a Mn(1)−N(4)−Mn(1d) bond angle of 103.1(2)°, resulting in a Mn···Mn distance between adjacent tetramers of 3.397(1) Å. The chains are well-isolated and intrachain hydrogen bonds or π−π stacking was not found [Figure (bottom)].
elements.clean_text: It is noteworthy that the double azido-oximato bridge is not a recognizable fragment in previously reported manganese/azido/oximato clusters. The bridging ligands are placed above and below the plane defined by the four Mn atoms in a pseudotetrahedral arrangement as a result of the local symmetry. An important feature is that the two O-Mn(1)-O axis are quasi-orthogonal between them. Each tetranuclear unit is linked to two equivalent ones by means of double end-on azido bridges [Figure  (top)], with a Mn(1)-N(4)-Mn(1d) bond angle of 103.1(2)°, resulting in a Mn⋅⋅⋅Mn distance between adjacent tetramers of 3.397(1) Å. The chains are well-isolated and intrachain hydrogen bonds or π-π stacking was not found [Figure  (bottom)].

elements.content: (Top) View of the chain of tetranuclear clusters linked by means of double azido bridges. (Bottom) Packing view along the [001] direction showing the well-isolated chains.
elements.clean_text: 2  (Top) View of the chain of tetranuclear clusters linked by means of double azido bridges. (Bottom) Packing view along the [001] direction showing the well-isolated chains.

elements.content: Direct-current (dc) susceptibility measurements were performed between 300 and 2 K on powdered samples under external fields of 0.3 T (300−30 K) and 0.015 T (30−2 K) to avoid saturation effects. The room temperature χM T value is 15.00 cm3 K mol−1, which is slightly greater than the g = 2.00 value of 14.75 cm3 K mol−1 expected for a MnII 2MnIII 2 unit. On cooling, χM T increases gradually, reaching a maximum value of 153 cm3 K mol−1 at 5.5 K. Below this temperature, χM T decreases to 75 cm3 K mol−1 at 1.8 K (Figure ). The continuous increase of the χM T product is only compatible with a system with ferromagnetic interactions inside the tetrameric units, and the maximum value of 153 cm3 K mol−1, clearly larger than the expected value for a ferromagnetic MnII 2MnIII 2 ring (S = 9, 45.00 cm3 K mol−1), indicates ferromagnetic interactions between the tetrameric clusters.
elements.clean_text: Direct-current (dc) susceptibility measurements were performed between 300 and 2 K on powdered samples under external fields of 0.3 T (300-30 K) and 0.015 T (30-2 K) to avoid saturation effects. The room temperature χM T value is 15.00 cm3 K mol-1, which is slightly greater than the g = 2.00 value of 14.75 cm3 K mol-1 expected for a MnII 2MnIII 2 unit. On cooling, χM T increases gradually, reaching a maximum value of 153 cm3 K mol-1 at 5.5 K. Below this temperature, χM T decreases to 75 cm3 K mol-1 at 1.8 K (Figure ). The continuous increase of the χM T product is only compatible with a system with ferromagnetic interactions inside the tetrameric units, and the maximum value of 153 cm3 K mol-1, clearly larger than the expected value for a ferromagnetic MnII 2MnIII 2 ring (S = 9, 45.00 cm3 K mol-1), indicates ferromagnetic interactions between the tetrameric clusters.

elements.content: χM T product vs T plot for complex 1. Inset: Magnetization measurement up to 5 T. Solid lines are guides for the eye.
elements.clean_text: 3  χM T product vs T plot for complex 1. Inset: Magnetization measurement up to 5 T. Solid lines are guides for the eye.

elements.content: These data support the 1D response of the system that magnetically can be described as a ferromagnetic chain of ferromagnetic rings with local ground state S = 9. Calculation of intracluster (assuming isolated clusters, J intra ≫ J inter) or intercluster (assuming isolated MnIII dimers, J intra ≪ J inter) coupling constants using the high T susceptibility values was ambiguous, indicating that both constants contribute significantly to the global coupling (Figure S1 in the ). Magnetization experiments at 2 K up to 5 T show a very fast magnetization (Mμβ = 7.3 under a field of only 0.15 T), suggesting that the stronger coupling may correspond to the interaction between MnIII ions mediated by double azido bridges. When the external field is increased, the magnetization gradually reaches a value equivalent to 16 electrons under the maximum field. Relevant features for the field-cooled/zero-field-cooled (FC/ZFC) measurements or hysteresis cycle were not found, indicating a blocking temperature lower than 2 K (Figure S2 in the ). Reduced magnetization experiments show a small gap at different fields, indicating moderate anisotropy of the ground state (Figure S3 in the ).
elements.clean_text: These data support the 1D response of the system that magnetically can be described as a ferromagnetic chain of ferromagnetic rings with local ground state S = 9. Calculation of intracluster (assuming isolated clusters, J intra ≫ J inter) or intercluster (assuming isolated MnIII dimers, J intra ≪ J inter) coupling constants using the high T susceptibility values was ambiguous, indicating that both constants contribute significantly to the global coupling (Figure S1 in the ). Magnetization experiments at 2 K up to 5 T show a very fast magnetization (Mμβ = 7.3 under a field of only 0.15 T), suggesting that the stronger coupling may correspond to the interaction between MnIII ions mediated by double azido bridges. When the external field is increased, the magnetization gradually reaches a value equivalent to 16 electrons under the maximum field. Relevant features for the field-cooled/zero-field-cooled (FC/ZFC) measurements or hysteresis cycle were not found, indicating a blocking temperature lower than 2 K (Figure S2 in the ). Reduced magnetization experiments show a small gap at different fields, indicating moderate anisotropy of the ground state (Figure S3 in the ).

elements.content: The structural data and the dc magnetic response of 1 allow a description of the system as well-isolated ferromagnetic chains of S = 9 local spins, and then to probe the magnetization dynamics of 1, alternating-current (ac) experiments were performed at 1.8−10 K under an oscillating field of 4 G. Susceptibility measurements show complete peaks above 1.8 K for frequencies in the 350−1500 Hz range and only the tail of the curves for low frequencies (Figure ). Debye treatment of the frequency dependence of ac returns an α value of 0.06 (Figure S4 in the ). The shift of the peak temperature (T p) is given by the parameter F = (ΔT p/T p)/Δ(log ω) = 0.14, which lies in the expected range for a SCM (0.1 < F < 0.3), discarding spin-glass behavior.
elements.clean_text: The structural data and the dc magnetic response of 1 allow a description of the system as well-isolated ferromagnetic chains of S = 9 local spins, and then to probe the magnetization dynamics of 1, alternating-current (ac) experiments were performed at 1.8-10 K under an oscillating field of 4 G. Susceptibility measurements show complete peaks above 1.8 K for frequencies in the 350-1500 Hz range and only the tail of the curves for low frequencies (Figure ). Debye treatment of the frequency dependence of ac returns an α value of 0.06 (Figure S4 in the ). The shift of the peak temperature (T p) is given by the parameter F = (ΔT p/T p)/Δ(log ω) = 0.14, which lies in the expected range for a SCM (0.1 < F < 0.3), discarding spin-glass behavior.

elements.content: Plot of the out-of-phase (χM′′) ac susceptibility signals for complex 1. Measurements were performed under an oscillating field of 4 G at the indicated frequencies.
elements.clean_text: 4  Plot of the out-of-phase (χM'') ac susceptibility signals for complex 1. Measurements were performed under an oscillating field of 4 G at the indicated frequencies.

elements.content: A fit of the Arrhenius plot from the ac χM′′ vs T data (Figure ) gives ΔE = 24 K and τ0 = 7.3 × 10−12 s, where ΔE is the energy barrier for the magnetization relaxation and τ0 is the preexponential factor. 1D Ising chain behavior is also confirmed by the linear fit of the linear region of ln(χ′T) vs T −1, which returns an energy gap Δξ = 7.7 K (Figure S5 in the ).
elements.clean_text: A fit of the Arrhenius plot from the ac χM'' vs T data (Figure ) gives ΔE = 24 K and τ0 = 7.3 × 10-12 s, where ΔE is the energy barrier for the magnetization relaxation and τ0 is the preexponential factor. 1D Ising chain behavior is also confirmed by the linear fit of the linear region of ln(χ'T) vs T -1, which returns an energy gap Δξ = 7.7 K (Figure S5 in the ).

elements.content: Peak temperatures of χM′′ ac susceptibility measurements fitted to the Arrhenius law for a complex.
elements.clean_text: 5  Peak temperatures of χM'' ac susceptibility measurements fitted to the Arrhenius law for a complex.

elements.content: The relatively low barrier found for 1 in spite of the ferromagnetic interactions along the chain and the high local spins should be attributed to the unfavorable alignment of the easy axis of the anisotropic centers Mn(1)/Mn(1b). Compound 1 provides a new example of the relevant versatility of the azido ligand in the syntheses of high-spin molecular or extended systems, and current efforts to obtain related chains with a series of (R)-pyridyloximato ligands are in due course.
elements.clean_text: The relatively low barrier found for 1 in spite of the ferromagnetic interactions along the chain and the high local spins should be attributed to the unfavorable alignment of the easy axis of the anisotropic centers Mn(1)/Mn(1b). Compound 1 provides a new example of the relevant versatility of the azido ligand in the syntheses of high-spin molecular or extended systems, and current efforts to obtain related chains with a series of (R)-pyridyloximato ligands are in due course.

elements.content: Crystallographic data for complex 1·2Et2O in CIF format, a Cole−Cole plot, and FC/ZFC measurement, a reduced magnetization plot, an Argand plot, and a linear fit of the semilog χM′T vs 1/T for 1. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.
elements.clean_text: Crystallographic data for complex 1⋅2Et2O in CIF format, a Cole-Cole plot, and FC/ZFC measurement, a reduced magnetization plot, an Argand plot, and a linear fit of the semilog χM'T vs 1/T for 1. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

elements.content: Crystal data for 1·Et2O: C14H14Mn2N13O2·C4H10O (580.38), orthorhombic, Ibam, a = 20.391(2) Å, b = 13.470(1) Å, c = 17.911(2) Å, V = 4919.5(7) Å3, Z = 8, T = 100(2) K, λ(Mo Kα) = 0.710 73 Å, 32 014 reflections collected, 2510 unique (R int = 0.040), R1 = 0.0479, wR2 = 0.1361. CCDC deposition number 802314.

metadata.title:
Assembly of [MnII
2MnIII
2] S = 9 Clusters via Azido Bridges: a New Single-Chain Magnet
